skeleton.description: Complete skull of an adult Night Monkey (Owl Monkey)
skeletonFacts: Exceptionally large orbits adapted for nocturnal vision
Enhanced nasal cavity structures for improved olfactory capabilities

bones.name: Teeth
funFacts: Night monkeys have a dental formula typical of New World monkeys
Their teeth are adapted for an omnivorous diet with emphasis on fruit and insects

bones.name: Inferior Nasal Conchae
funFacts: The complex structure of these bones helps night monkeys maintain keen smell in the dark
They play a crucial role in conditioning air before it reaches the lungs

bones.name: Lacrimal Bones
funFacts: Night monkeys have the largest eyes relative to skull size of all primates
Their lacrimal bones are specially adapted to support their large eyes

bones.name: Nasal Bones
funFacts: Night monkey nasal bones help support an enhanced sense of smell
The shape of these bones contributes to their distinctive facial appearance
